Text:
Thank You
v8 a10

Spanish subtitles:
http://www.opensubtitles.org/en/subtitles/3673274/un-prophete-es
cant get the english subs.. downloaded the file from the link above.. but the subs dont show up.. can anyone please..

fmirza - Use VLC Media Player. All you have to do it is use the options bar to go to VIDEO > SUBTITLES TRACKS > OPEN FILE and then find the file on your hardrive (I always put the subtitles in movie folder). Hope that helps.

Subtitles are not included in this torrent.  The time stamp files are there but no actual subs.  Found them at:  http://subscene.com/ (free registration required.)  Make sure you get the vomit 2 file version.

Those subs are terrible. I thought they were really off during the movie - it was hard to follow and the stuff they were saying just didn't make that much sense... very vague. I got the DVD today and compared just 20 seconds of subs and it's awful. It's better than no subs, but you'll miss a lot of details.
I should clarify - DVD subs were perfect, the subs in those links were awful compared to them.
I am using the english subtitles from http://www.opensubtitles.org/en/subtitles/3669105/un-prophete-en and they are perfectly fine
The subs in this download do not open in vlc, there is an error, and the links posted here are not suitable
